meanings.definition: To bring together or gather into a collective whole.
meanings.sent1: The teacher collectivises the students for a group project.
meanings.sent2: The community collectivises resources to help those in need.
meanings.sent3: The ants collectivises food for the winter, working together as a team.
meanings.sent4: The conductor collectivises the musicians' talents to create beautiful music.
meanings.sent5: The farmer collectivises the crops for market, showcasing the abundance of the harvest.

meanings.definition: To organize or operate as a collective group.
meanings.sent1: The workers collectivises to negotiate better wages.
meanings.sent2: The activists collectivises to advocate for change in the community.
meanings.sent3: The birds collectivises to build a nest, each contributing in their own way.
meanings.sent4: The team collectivises their skills to win the championship.
meanings.sent5: The volunteers collectivises efforts to clean up the park, showing the power of teamwork.
